subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: QS news update
msgSnippet: ... Not that I know of.  But the CMU dictionary lists this as IH M P L AH M EH N T IH NG, which maps to It-May-Pea-Low-Ah-May-Et-No-Tea-It-Ing. So I can t
messageBody:
Anthony Hagan scripsit:

> As I said in post 1467, I don't like the dropped #3Tea in many QS
> news words. An example is "implementing" which was converted
> to ...#28Et-#23No-#26It-#21iNG. Should we put the #3Tea in (to
> get ...#28Et-#23No-#3Tea-#26It-#21iNG), or is the dropped #3Tea a
> widespread Americanism which should remain?

Not that I know of. But the CMU dictionary lists this as IH M P L AH
M EH N T IH NG, which maps to It-May-Pea-Low-Ah-May-Et-No-Tea-It-Ing.
So I can't imagine where the dropped T is coming from; definitely not
the dictionary itself.

> "Human" was transcribed as #17Ye-#40OOze-#22May-#36Utter-#23No.
> Should this be #19He-#17Ye-#40OOze... or H-dropping the norm in
> America?

It's not uncommon, but the dictionary does show HH Y UW M AH N.

In both these words, the AH is an error: we don't say "implahmenting"
or "humahn", so it should be A in the dictionary's ad-hoc notation.

--
Yes, chili in the eye is bad, but so is your John Cowan
ear. However, I would suggest you wash your cowan@...
hands thoroughly before going to the toilet. http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
--gadicath
